item.title: Notes from the Deep Reinforcement Learning Course by HuggingFace
item.author: Nicolas Lecrique
item.description: Notes from the Deep Reinforcement Learning Course by HuggingFace UNIT 1. INTRODUCTION TO DEEP REINFORCEMENT LEARNING Definition Reinforcement learning is a framework where an agent learns by doing actions within an environment and receiving rewards Return function Let $r_t$ be the reward received at the time step $t$.The cumulative reward(=return) $R(\tau)$ received from time step $t$, following the trajectory $\tau$ (sequence of states/actions) with a discount rate $\gamma$ is defined by:

item.title: DeepLearning.AI MLOps Specialization notes
item.author: Nicolas Lecrique
item.description: DeepLearning.AI MLOps Specialization notes Course 1: Introduction to Machine Learning in Production Week 1: Overview of the ML Lifecycle and Deployment Concept drift / Data drift When data in production diverges from training data. Steps of a ML project Scoping Data modeling Deployment This is not a linear but an iterative process. Deployment patterns gradual (Canary) deployment: Send an increasing proportion of traffic to the new version. blue-green deployment: Add a router between the old and new algorithm then switch, when we have to switch all users at once but are able to rollback instantly.

item.title: Kubernetes concepts
item.author: Nicolas Lecrique
item.description: Kubernetes concepts Node: server (physical or VM) Pod: low level abstraction over a container (abstract docker or another container technology). Usually one container by pod each pod has its own virtual IP address (internal to K8). if The pod die, the new one has a new Ip address. Service component: a permanent IP address that can be attached to each pod so pods can communicates with each others. It’s also a Load balancer to distribute requests to pods less busy (which are replacted)

item.title: collapse

item.description: baisse de la conso pétrole et gaz Effet d’ordre 1 que ce soit par épuisement des ressources, conflits, ou consience écologique, la production d’énergie fossile va baisser les énergies fossiles représentent la grande majorité de la production d’énergie si la production d’énergie baisse, la production de biens, d’infrastructures et de services va baisser. le PIB et le pouvoir d’achat va diminuer, les prix vont augmenter Effet d’ordre 2 L’énergie devenant le facteur limitant de l’économie, celle ci va devenir cruciale et chère:

item.title: s'adapter ou s'effondrer
item.author: Nicolas Lecrique
item.description: l’argent ne donne pas un droit à polluer plus Justification des inégalités, du capitalisme et du libéralisme. faire grossir le gateau: si tu créé plus, si tu travaille plus tu gagne plus propriété privé et héritage 2 arguments entendables Ca ne marche pas pour l’environnement c’est un gateau fixe, un bien en quantité fini il appartient à tout le monde et à personne => donc il n’y a aucune raison morale que les riches puissent polluer plus
